title: The Edinburgh gazetteer, or geographical dictionary ...
snippet: Population 1405. Parr's Point, the south-east point ofHalf Moon bay, on the north-east side ofthe island of St Christopher's, in the WestIndies. Parra, a small island in the gulf ofPanama, one of the group called the Pearlislands, on account of the pearls found on itscoast.

title: The Edinburgh gazetteer, or geographical dictionary ...
snippet: 4. S.Palmetto, the most easterly point ofthe bay so called, on the south-west coastof the island of St Christopher's, in the WestIndies. The shore is rocky, and a sort protects the bay.

title: The Edinburgh gazetteer, or geographical dictionary ...
snippet: 140 miles E. N. E. of Kerman. Mastic Gut, on the south-west side ofthe island of St Christopher's, in the WestIndies, is between Moline's Gut on thenorth- west,and Godwin's Gut on the southeast. Mastigon, a river which runs westward into Lake Michigan, about 11 milesnorth of La Grande Riviere.

title: The Edinburgh gazetteer, or geographical dictionary ...
snippet: The Dutchpart would have proved a flourishing colony, had it not been destitute of a goodharbour, and lain too far to leeward, tocarry on a convenient commerce with thewindward islands. In 1744, a handful ofEnglish, headed by the deputy-governorof Anguilla, with two St Christopher'sprivateers, drove the French from the possession of their part of the island. InMarch 1801, it was taken by the British, but has since been restored.

title: The Edinburgh gazetteer, or geographical dictionary ...
snippet: It is supposed to contain 30,000 acres, of whichalmost two-thirds are very mountainous, orvery barren. In the year 1632, sir ThomasWarner, governor of St Christopher's, senthither a small .colony of English. LordWilloughby afterwards sent a reinforcementof hands to settle it in a regular manner ;and their industry turned to such account,that for several years this island prosperedmore than that of Antigua, and exportedsugar, jtinger, cotton, and indigo.

title: The Edinburgh gazetteer, or geographical dictionary ...
snippet: Population 2100. Moline's Gut, a river on the southwest side of the island of St Christopher's,, in the West Indies, with anchorage nearits mouth, of from 5 to 10 fathoms. Molineux's Harbour, a bay on thesouth-east coast of Tavai Poenammoo, thesouthern island of New Zealand.
